rounds.response:
Looking at the flop, my hand contains:

- **7♠ 10♣** in the hole
- Board: **Q♥ 8♠ 7♦**

I have:

- Pair of **7**'s (7♠ 7♦)
- **10♣** is my kicker
- Backdoor straight draw possibility (need 9 and J for broadway, or 9 for a straight)

Unless my opponent hits something on the turn or river, my pair may actually be good here. My 10 kicker isn’t great for a pair of 7’s on this board, but he did *check* the flop, suggesting either weakness or some deception.

Given:

- 980 chips in the pot vs. my bankroll of 980
- Board relatively uncoordinated besides potential JT for the straight

I’m going to bet small to gather information and see where I stand—around half the pot sized bet. This gives me fold equity if I’m ahead, while not risking too much if he calls or raises.

[Bet 20]

rounds.response:
I’m in the small-blind with 3♦ 9♥ (off-suit, low, unconnected). Facing Villain’s big-blind completion, I’ve already posted the small-blind (20).  

I see no value in continuing with this weak hand – I can’t credibly represent strength and don’t improve on most boards. Rather than throw more chips at air, I’ll reduce my risk and regain positional advantage next hand.

[Fold]

rounds.response:
We’re heads-up and in the big-blind position with 8 **♠** K **♠**, 980 BB behind after the big-blind ante, and facing a dry flop

Q **♠** 4 **♦** 3 **♠**

What we have
• K-high back-door flush draw (only one spade so far)  
• Two overcards (K & the gut-shot Q)  
• Very little showdown value if villain has any pair.

Action is on us first (out of position) and there is no current bet to face.  
Checking keeps the pot small but gives villain a free card and allows him to stab at it when he misses as well.  Betting small accomplishes two things:

1. Denies equity to random overcards our opponent may have (like J♦ 7♦ etc.).  
2. Lets us take down the 40-chip pot right now a good chunk of the time, adding +4 % to our stack with little risk.

40 chips is 1/2 pot—a normal 2/3-pot c-bet size would be ~27, but we don’t have that denomination in the action list.  40 is the next legal increment and is still only 4 % of our stack, so we can comfortably fire and fold to a raise.

[Bet 40]
